summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 between FBI agents and a federal prosecutor coordinating logistics for Ghislaine Maxwell to review sensitive discovery materials at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). The emails discuss scheduling, personnel, and strict instructions that FBI agents are not to speak with Maxwell as she is represented by counsel.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the discovery review; she is to review sensitive materials at the MDC with her attorney present. The FBI is instructed not to speak with her.

connections.description: N., an FBI agent, is part of the team facilitating Maxwell's review of discovery materials, under strict instructions not to engage her in conversation.

events.title: Maxwell Discovery Review Meeting
events.description: A scheduled meeting for Ghislaine Maxwell to review sensitive discovery materials at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) from 8am to 3pm, with her attorney present and FBI agents facilitating.

events.title: Cancelled Discovery Meeting
events.description: A previously scheduled discovery review meeting for Tuesday, October 20, 2020, was cancelled by Maxwell's attorney, necessitating rescheduling.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: In October 2020, Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) and was scheduled to review sensitive discovery materials related to her case.
The FBI was involved in facilitating this review, using a secure laptop, but agents were explicitly instructed not to speak with Maxwell as she was represented by counsel.
Logistics were coordinated between an Assistant United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York and multiple FBI agents, including Special Agent N.
A meeting originally set for October 20, 2020, was cancelled by Maxwell's attorney and rescheduled for October 23, 2020.
